alert.note: Alert for Nemaha; Otoe (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 7:45PM CDT until June 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NEMAHA AND SOUTHEASTERN OTOE COUNTIES... At 745 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Peru, or 6 miles northeast of Auburn, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Nemaha and southeastern Otoe Counties, including the following locations... Brownville State Recreation Area and Duck Creek Recreation Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
